required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Consumer Health IT Tools: Impact on Experience, Access, and Outcomes for Patients With Complex Chronic Conditions
clinical_study.official_title: Consumer Health IT Tools: Impact on Patient Experience, Access, and Health Outcomes for Patients With Complex Chronic Conditions

brief_summary.textblock: Patient use of health IT tools to interact with healthcare providers and delivery systems, including exchanging secure messages with their medical providers and using other web-based tools, has great potential to increase patient access to care, change the way healthcare is delivered, and affect patient clinical outcomes. This study will examine the impact of implementation and use of consumer health IT tools on patient-reported access to care, utilization of medical care services, and clinical outcomes.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Ambulatory Care Sensitive Conditions (ACSC) Hospitalizations. Portal Users vs Those Who Are Not Portal Users
primary_outcome.description: Number of ambulatory care sensitive conditions (ACSC) hospitalizations per 1000 patients per month among those who accessed the portal and those who did not access the portal.
Patient-reported reasons for using the patient portal

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with chronic conditions
- Patient had at least 10-month membership in 2005
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients less than age 18

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Adult patients with at least 10-month membership in 2005
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Note: the participants in the Medical Record only arm of the study and the participants in the Survey arm of the study are two different groups of participants. The Medical Record arm of the study includes data from January 2006 to December 2007. The Survey was completed between March 2015 and April 2016.

group.title: Adult Patients With Chronic Conditions: Medical Record Data
group.description: Medical record data of adult patients with diabetes and/or complex chronic conditions in a large integrated delivery system.

group.title: Adult Patients With Chronic Conditions: Survey Data
group.description: Survey data completed by adult patients with diabetes and/or complex chronic conditions in a large integrated delivery system. Participants were given the option to complete the survey by mail, by phone with a research assistant, or online.

group.title: Adult Patients With Chronic Conditions: Medical Record Data
group.description: Medical record data of adult patients with diabetes and/or complex chronic conditions in a large integrated delivery system.

group.title: Adult Patients With Chronic Conditions Survey Data
group.description: Survey data competed by adult patients with diabetes and/or complex chronic conditions in a large integrated delivery system. Participants were given the option to complete the survey by mail, by phone with a research assistant, or online

outcome.title: Number of Ambulatory Care Sensitive Conditions (ACSC) Hospitalizations. Portal Users vs Those Who Are Not Portal Users
outcome.description: Number of ambulatory care sensitive conditions (ACSC) hospitalizations per 1000 patients per month among those who accessed the portal and those who did not access the portal.
outcome.population: Only those participants who had an event (ACSC Hospitalization) were included in this analysis.

group.title: ACSC Hospitalizations for Those Accessing the Portal
group.description: ACSC Hospitalizations for those accessing the portal.

group.title: ACSC Hospitalizations - Non Portal Users.
group.description: ACSC Hospitalizations for those who did not access the portal.

measure.title: Number of Ambulatory Care Sensitive Conditions (ACSC) Hospitalizations. Portal Users vs Those Who Are Not Portal Users
measure.description: Number of ambulatory care sensitive conditions (ACSC) hospitalizations per 1000 patients per month among those who accessed the portal and those who did not access the portal.
measure.population: Only those participants who had an event (ACSC Hospitalization) were included in this analysis.

outcome.title: Patient Self-report Survey Data
outcome.description: Patient-reported reasons for using the patient portal
outcome.population: Only those participants completing a survey and indicating that they used the portal were included in this analysis.

group.title: Survey Data: Portal Users
group.description: Adult patients with complex chronic conditions who registered to use the portal completed a survey describing reasons for using the portal.

measure.title: Patient Self-report Survey Data
measure.description: Patient-reported reasons for using the patient portal
measure.population: Only those participants completing a survey and indicating that they used the portal were included in this analysis.

class.title: Use portal because it is convenient
Say the portal integrates with other health care

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
